column4: I tried mounting my old lvm partition from my other drive (a fedora install), it seemed to mount it, but nothing is there
it was fedora 4, I hope i havn't lost everything *sob*
filesystem shows up as 'unknown' in GParted
first rule of file recover - don't panic
I seem to be ok at the moment, whats the next rule?
i'm pretty sure it was an ext3 filesystem using lvm
The Disks manager shows a 'Free Space' partition with a size of 4096GiB
please read this before you attempt anything: http://codeworks.gnomedia.com/archives/2005/general/lvm_recovery/
i'm reading that, but i cant even mount the ext3 filesystem to begin recovering the lvm
maybe boot off a live cd
cant access /etc/lvm to begin with, which is the crux of the solution
